problem_text:
20.66. A Schmidt (p, q)-group is a finite non-nilpotent group all of whose proper subgroups are nilpotent and whose Sylow p-subgroup is normal. The N-critical graph ΓNc(G) of a finite group G is a directed graph on the vertex set of all prime divisors of |G| in which (p, q) is an edge of ΓNc(G) if and only if G has a Schmidt (p, q)-subgroup. Suppose that a finite group G is such that G = AB = AC = BC, where A, B, C are subgroups of G. Is ΓNc(G) = ΓNc(A) ∪ΓNc(B) ∪ΓNc(C)? This is true if A, B, C are soluble.
V. I. Murashka, A. F. Vasil’ev
